data: A lexical resource based on WordNet that assigns sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to the meaning (synset) of individual words.

Contains nearly 5,000 text snippets collected from financial news and press releases of companies listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange in Finland. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.

A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and semantic web technologies, aiming to more accurately recognize, interpret, and process opinions in this context.

Includes entity-specific sentiment annotations to address the challenge of dealing with headlines where multiple entities exist and sentiments differ. This dataset, human-annotated with over 10,700 news headlines, helps understand sentiment shifts corresponding to specific entities in financial news.

A dataset of tokenized and annotated verbatim transcripts of Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, meeting minutes, and press conferences. This resource aims to analyze the language used by central banks and understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets.

A dataset annotated with relationships within financial documents, containing approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relationship types extracted from SEC 10-X filings. It spans 8 entity pairs (e.g., Person-Title, Organization-Amount). It is useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.

A dataset collected from diverse news sources and evaluated by human experts, allowing researchers to investigate the impact of news headlines on price volatility, asset comparison, and other financial events.
A dataset aimed at Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial domain, useful for identifying and classifying financial entities within text data.

A multilingual financial NLP dataset containing real-world financial article headlines in 15 languages. It is annotated with high-level and low-level topics and supports multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answering pairs created by financial experts, accompanied by detailed analysis of financial reports. It focuses on deep reasoning over financial data as training data for answering complex financial queries.
